result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy A Martin

defendant.name: Martin, Timothy A
defendant.address: 115 N Bell St, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:54 p.m. Defendant Timothy A Martin in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15TR3093 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM454 - DRI. 15TR3165 - Dismissed outright. No statement by DE. Court orders: $850 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP, 6 mo DL rev, OWI Assessment. Bond previously posted to be applied.

2:04 pm case called. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states matter can be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

2:46 pm cases called. Defendant Timothy A Martin in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court vacates default judgment entered, and withdraws warrant previously authorized.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  NGP entered to all cases.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.

2:40 pm cases called. 15CM454, 15TR3093 & 15TR3165. Defendant Timothy A Martin not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders the $250 bond forfeited. Court orders warrant, State of Wisconsin. Court enters default judgment in 15TR3093-guideline penalties of $761.50, 6 month DL revocation, OWI Assessment-No IID. 60 days to pay. Court dismisses outright 15TR3165.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
